newsitem.title: UK: ABI says intermediaries up share of UK life market.
newsitem.headline: ABI says intermediaries up share of UK life market.

text.p: Independent intermediaries in the financial services sector increased their share of new life and pensions business to 38 percent from 34 percent in the second quarter of the year, the Association of British Insurers said.
Company agents' share fell from 63 percent to 59 percent year-on-year, and direct sales were steady at three percent.
"Independent intermediaries have done particularly well to increase their market share to 38 percent of new business," said the ABI's director general Mark Boleat.
The ABI released new life and pensions business figures earlier this week.
It said then that new life and pensions single premiums in the second quarter rose to 4.57 billion stg from 2.93 billion stg in the same year ago period.
New annual life and pensions premiums in the second quarter were 600 million stg compared to 515 million stg a year ago.
